summary: SettingsCard UI was modified to remove header/title and labels, but an <Input> is still rendered in the first settings field area, which may correspond to the XPath that was required to be removed. Additionally, new UI elements (helper text and a conditional "Save Changes" button) appear to have been added beyond the four specified removals.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove the element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[1]/input[1] (the first Settings input) so it is no longer rendered.
missing_requirements.reason: The updated SettingsCard.tsx still renders an <Input> inside the first settings field block (<div className="space-y-2"> ... <Input ... />), which likely maps to the referenced first input XPath position.

hallucinated_features.description: Added helper/description text under the helpline input: "This number will be shown as a tappable click-to-call helpline button in the header."
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asked to remove four specific existing elements and explicitly required that no other UI elements outside those XPaths be changed; adding new text is an additional UI change.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a conditional "Save Changes" button that appears when local settings differ from stored settings.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; the BuildRequest scope was limited to removing four specified elements and making no other UI changes.
